wikipedia_page.main: John Edmunds is a British academic who set up the Drama Department at the University College of Wales, Aberystwyth where he was Head from 1973 to 1985.  Edmunds trained as an actor but is best known as an ABC TV and Associated Rediffusion continuity announcer.

response: Other notable presenters have included John Edmunds, Peter Woods, Richard Whitmore, Angela Rippon, Jan Leeming, John Humphrys, John Simpson, Sue Lawley, Julia Somerville, Andrew Harvey,  Moira Stuart, Nicholas Witchell, Martyn Lewis, Michael Buerk, Peter Sissons and George Alagiah.

At the age of 18, he went to the University College of Wales, Aberystwyth, to study Drama under John Edmunds. However, he had a talent for music, and it was at Aberystwyth that he began writing and playing music seriously for the first time. In 2013 he was made a Fellow of Aberystwyth University.

link_mentions.page: List of former BBC newsreaders and journalists
response: * John Edmunds – TV newsreader from September 1968 until September 1973, and then again in October 1974 and between September 1979 and June 1981. He also presented the BBC's regional London TV magazine, Town And Around in 1968/1969
* John Edmunds (English academic) (died 1544), vice-chancellor of Cambridge University
* John Edmunds (presenter) (born 1930s), BBC presenter and professor of drama
* John Edmunds Apartment House, historic house in Florida
